Key Match Events: Milson scored in the 90+4' and 90+7' minutes
Pre-Game Insights: Ghana will host Angola at the Baba Yara Sports Stadium on Thursday, aiming to kick off their 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifying campaign with a victory.
Ghana's recent form includes a dramatic 2-1 victory over Mali and a 4-3 win over Central African Republic, both in 2026 World Cup qualifiers.
Angola enters this fixture on a high after winning the COSAFA Cup in July, triumphing in the competition for the fourth time in July.

Ghana appear to have rediscovered their form under the new coach, and they have also enjoyed success in this fixture, which is why we are predicting a victory for them on Thursday against Angola, a team that has struggled in AFCON qualifying matches.
Post-Match Reflections: Ghana won the match 1-0 against Angola with goals from Mumin in the 45+5' minute and Seidu in the 72' minute
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ghana's unbeaten record against the visitors, winning and drawing two each against them in four previous meetings.
Angola's qualifying record for the last AFCON was mixed, with two wins, three draws, and one defeat.
Others: Ghana's possible starting lineup: Ati-Zigi; Seidu, Djiku, Salisu, Mensah; Samed, Partey; Fatawu, Kudus, Semenyo; Ayew
Angola's possible starting lineup: Neblu; Mata, Gasper, Carmo, Cruz; Fredy, Show, Nteka; Milson, Mabululu, Dala
